intro: Pilosella chaerophylla, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cooler climates. Its leaves are hairy and closely clustered, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pilosella chaerophylla is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
